website_summaries.verdict: Some may find the balance to be handle-heavy, but we appreciate this 3-knife set's sleek black appearance and durability.
pros: 8" stainless steel blades with sleek black coating
Extremely durable, even after hours of practice
cons: Tips break easily in harder targets
Not as well balanced as higher-end sets

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners...or people who like to trash their blades.
customer_reviews.text: For me, these are perfect. I prefer my knives very slightly blade heavy, and these are just that. I've been throwing them in my basement at a homemade target for a while now, and the only thing that I can think of being wrong with them is that a few ricochet throws have put little scratches in the paint and folded over one of the edges on the blade near the handle. Overall they are fantastic for the price, if you're in the market for a knife to learn to throw, or just some blades to beat the Christ out of, these are your knives!
customer_reviews.author: Braden Butts

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price, sturdy knives, featherweight throwers.
customer_reviews.text: They're good knives. They throw well if you know what you're doing. Very lightweight which can have both advantages and disadvantages. Sturdy as hell, i'm throwing into a fence and if they don't stick or they bounce back it's onto small rocks and these blades hold up nicely. A great price and very strong knives. Highly recommended for gifting to a youngster whos learning as they aren't heavy and they won't break the bank and they'll take some modicum of abuse. I only have four stars because they are so very feather weight. And I like a meaty blade. But I do really love these throwers. Great backups. They're always with me in case I need them. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Maya

customer_reviews.title: Nice blades
customer_reviews.text: A bit small for my tastes but an easy throw , I've been throwing blades for a long time now. After hundreds of throws they have taken no damage (aside from minor chips from striking other blades of course, in my experience this is unavoidable).
customer_reviews.author: BurnMan

customer_reviews.title: “Perfect point” How about DULL AS HELL POINT
customer_reviews.text: These knives can’t hold any edge, they sharpen about as good as a graham cracker, they bend as fast as a string, and worst of all the sheath is probably the most expensive piece of this kit. I actually tested to see how useful they were by taking an old rusty butter knife made of aluminum, sharpening it and throwing it, to see how effective these were to a rusty peice of garbage. Turns out that a sharpened butter knife is EASIER TO THROW, EASIER TO SHARPEN, and actually HOLDS AN EDGE FOR 3 SECONDS. DO NOT BUY THESE
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Umm okay hear me out...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a knife thrower. I wanted a small knife I could put on the belt and use as a whatever knife...these came in a pack of 3. I see some complaints but mine were sharp AF from jump. I fully expected to be sharpening them myself (as I need the practice anyway) but that'll have to wait. Lol I think I'll go out tomorrow and give them some work. I bet it'll make quick work of a steak. I do wish the fit going in the sheath was a lil tighter but I'm being picky. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: I. Truss

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for myself and daughters to learn how to throw and they’ve held up nicely. Much better than ones I purchased from a sporting goods store. The tip isn’t super thin so it doesn’t bend every time you land a shot on something hard. But I do recommend setting up a softer wood or thick cardboard for your target. If you only throw into wood I imagine these will bend and the tips will break after a while. I bought two sets and they have taken some abuse. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Best $10 I ever spent!
customer_reviews.text: Love this set! I'm new to throwing and found it very easy with this set. I wanted to learn no spin style so I picked these up. I throw them against cardboard sheets layed up against plywood. I either lay some carpet down in the garage or outside with dirt below the target , so I haven't had any break. The tips seem to hold up to even the plywood. I like the balance and weight I find perfect. The weight is in the front portion on the blade , and I find the weight just right to easily to get a sidearm snap!
customer_reviews.author: workoutnut2010

customer_reviews.title: Good knives
customer_reviews.text: This item is pretty good and durable. Unfortunately the blades edge has already been chipping away from about 2 weeks of use. Well the blade has had contact from the other knife which kinda makes sense. I already lost one in the grass though that’s not really the product’s fault. It was really sharp but got dull over time as I was throwing. It sticks in wood and trees pretty well even with the dull tip. The paint has worn out as well. But overall amazing set of knives.
customer_reviews.author: San I

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with a little work
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed in these Knives but then I wrapped the handles in paracord and practiced a bit and BOOM!! LOVE EM!!! Oh but with the paracord they don't fit in the holster. But who cares they look awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous pieces of tin. Indoors only
customer_reviews.text: These knives are ok if you have a dart board or don't want to go past 8ft. Anything else and they are too light and dangerous. The ricochet on them is really bad especially for kids. Plus the black doesn't help when they are flying at your head. I recommend a grand way throwing knife for under 20.00. You will have it forever and will get alot of use out of it
customer_reviews.author: A Mackerelote

customer_reviews.title: not a bad knife
customer_reviews.text: they would not stick and they are not returnable i got a refund and still have the knives i gave them away
customer_reviews.author: california  dreaming

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent set..
customer_reviews.text: I've used throwing knives for a while now, but the were all more the spear tip style; these were the first like this. When the came, they were actually pretty nice. They were made well, very sturdy, nice edge on them; the only one possible flaw is that they were just a bit heavy for great throws, but it may just take getting use to.
customer_reviews.author: ESmith1730

customer_reviews.title: Excellent knives for the price
customer_reviews.text: Of course they are not perfect. Made of relatively soft metal so you need to re-sharpen frequently. But overall good quality and look nice besides the need to re-sharpen frequently and therefore getting shorter with time. Overall holding pretty well. I re-ordered Good value
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: So far after just a few days use, no bent tips and has a good balance. The package when it had arrived had a very good weight to it, I was worried that it would be very light and cheap as my first reaction to affordable products is that I would get robbed but I. An honestly say it is a good quality product for the money you spend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Zamora

customer_reviews.title: Nothing in the Envelope
customer_reviews.text: When I got my package it was placed under a brick by the mail people, I think they thought it was too light and would float away, so when I opened the package there was literally nothing in it. No packing slip, receipt or the knives. I reached out to get help and never heard anything back. I am really disappointed. It looks as though the product was never even put in the envelope, the envelope was sealed but nothing was in it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Harris

customer_reviews.title: They're cheap junk, but fun...
customer_reviews.text: You can spend a lot of money on an expensive knife to throw. Or you can buy the set of cheaply made, reasonably good steel, Holds an edge pretty good knives and chuck them at a target for fun. They also double as utility knives for camping etc. Bang for your buck they're good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Knives seem good, sheath has one issue
customer_reviews.text: The knives seem pretty good for the money. My only complaint is regarding the sheath which is largely built well. The Velcro on the strap doesn't attach properly and makes it possible that the knives might fall out. Disappointing in an otherwise rather nice product.
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my sons birthday. I told him that he couldn't use them until he had made a target. He spent a whole 2 weeks constructing his target. We used a 24"x48" piece of plywood. Probably not the best target material, but even with that he was able to go from sticking none to almost 50% in less than a month. I bet if I were to make a target out of a different material then he would be in the 66%!range. Knives are sharp and ready for throwing immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Toad Grinder

customer_reviews.title: On the cheap side, but that's not a bad thing.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good buy for the money. My family and I have been throwing these for three days now and they have held up. One of the blade edges, from throwing alone, has a couple of chips lost out of the blade - so, the quality isn't top shelf here, but it sufficient for some beginning fun and working out the technique at the price charged. I'd recommend them, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: 4phunk

customer_reviews.title: Nice little throwing knives.
customer_reviews.text: I have been throwing things since I was a kid, rocks and screwdrivers at a tree (not very safe)....It took me about 30 minutes to figure out the distance and now I can stick these knives on a plywood board I have set up. They are very light and very sharp on the tip. I guess for the price it's a pretty good deal to figure out if knife throwing is your thing or not. They have a nice case that you can put on your belt and be ready for anything. In my opinion the quality is good and the balance is fine. Fun to play with.
customer_reviews.author: William P Teague

customer_reviews.title: Nice knives
customer_reviews.text: I winged a couple off of targets and they held up to the abuse well, which is all I can ask for. They're fun to throw and durable so far. If I had it to do over I would have picked heavier blades for log distance throwing. That is not a ding on these though, they're great for close range. FYI 07/23/2018 These are so much fun, and handle the abuse so well, that I ordered two more sets. Very good price for a great set of throwing knives.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty stout little knives, they come in a cheap sheath and have held up well to hitting each other. They don't have a positive tip balance so they may not be particularly great for a beginner, but they certare cheap and throwable
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Very very durable. I have thrown these knives hundreds of times each an they've barely lost paint. Once the tip sticks in the target many times the paint wears down a bit on the tip, but that is to be expected. I got these as starting knives so they got thrown around a LOT. Into the ground, hit some trees, scraped a metal propane tank, and these things still look great!
customer_reviews.author: Avengersrox

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected
customer_reviews.text: Well done. My complaint is they are too small for me but ideal for a person with smaller hands in the family. They came oiled, individually wrapped, Sharp, and decent nylon holder. Can’t go wrong for 12 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately!
customer_reviews.text: One of these chipped within ten minutes of use and customer service is nowhere to be found. Save your money and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: kaye basedow

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful heavy blades. Perfect for throwing and self defence
customer_reviews.text: These are seriously heavy knives. I bought them for practice as well as self defense and they are definately heavy enough to be deadly. The blade is beautifully thick almost like a small sword. I was surprised. The spider is beautiful and cute and gives the blades a nice ninja quality. Straight throw technique was first perfected by the Japanese so good job! Thank you to the workers for making such a fine blade!
customer_reviews.author: C Wons

customer_reviews.title: Great starter set for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great knives for someone learning to throw, and wanting to practice their accuracy and consistency. They are lighter than I thought, so throwing from further away has been a bit of a struggle. They are made of stainless steel, so yes they can dent if you treat them too roughly. I try to make sure I throw them in a grassy are, but I live in the desert so sometimes that's tough. Came out of the box sharp! so watch yourself. Very happy with this purchase. Would recommend it for anyone who wants to learn some throwing skills. Ill be buying more soon!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these about a year ago and they still are working great for throwing. They are amazing for beginners and very durable. I’ve thrown them at wood for a year and they only have paint damage.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Good balance, durability, and “the feel”
customer_reviews.text: Awesome knives for beginners. They require a real proper throw to get into the board, but when you master that weight and see them get in, you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin Gredeskoul

customer_reviews.title: New to throwing knives
customer_reviews.text: My son loved throwing stars, but wanted to try throwing knives. The set looks good for an inexpensive basic set and my son has enjoyed trying to learn how to throw. They fly well and straight but we have not mastered the skill yet. I do not believe it is the knives' fault.
customer_reviews.author: M. H.

customer_reviews.title: Great throwing knives
customer_reviews.text: First time knife thrower so I was looking for something cheap yet functional. These are perfect for beginners and I highly recommend. They are easy to throw but have good balance.
customer_reviews.author: Ofelia

customer_reviews.title: ves for beginners there's no intermediate throwing knives
customer_reviews.text: As for one of the star questions up there for beginners what kind of a question is that for throwing knives they're throwing knives they're good those dirty heavy enough equality price value yeah
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: I think they are good beginner knives
customer_reviews.text: I think they are good beginner knives. They are well balanced and heavier than I expected based on the price. I've thrown them a lot and they have not broken after bouncing off the target and hitting the floor numerous times. They are just a little dinged up, but still perform. For the low price, I am very well pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Basil

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size throwing knives
customer_reviews.text: This was my first set of throwing knives (I now have 3) and as far as size they are perfect. 7 inch ones seem too short/small and 12 is just too gigantic for daily practice. These knives are well-balanced and I have about 1500 throws on the combined. The metal is not the strongest, but they can obviously be sharpened and so far nothing's broken. To sum this up I'll just say this: YOU CANNOT BEAT THIS PRICE VS QUALITY COMBO
customer_reviews.author: oleg v

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for.my husband for our 11th Anniversary! The steel anniversary! They are Amazing and I know he is going to Love them!!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Krzepina

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall a worthy set of cheap throwing knives for beginners well balance with a few nice index markers seem durable enough and they thro no spin pretty nicely both upside down and rightbside up. I will add that the blade is sharp which isnt ideal for throwing knive as you could slice your finger or yand with spin throw. But if youre aware and stick to no spin with these knives youll be able to learn some proper form with ease!
customer_reviews.author: austin frenzel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent begginners
customer_reviews.text: Great set for begginners like me. Super sturdy and easy to re-edge. The nylon sheath is sturdy and the knives are a decent weight for straight throw or spin.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor James MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: first throwing knives
customer_reviews.text: great for most throwing techniques. I especially like them for no-spin. I did break a tip off one of them pretty fast but it was from some pretty severe abuse. I'll probably be buying more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Jay g

customer_reviews.title: First timer
customer_reviews.text: First throwing knives that I have ever thrown and I am learning ..... but for the money they are great. I throw it one and two spin great roughly six and twelve ft. I can’t no spin them though but again it’s my first time throwing. Great knife for me definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and easy to take car of
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, center-balanced, smooth Full tang throwing knives for durability and a sheath to hold them all on your belt. One problem I had was being all black makes them very hard to find in some cases. I was throwing in a grass backyard that had some dirt and straw. I've spent at least an hour cumulative searching for knives, even though you watch it go to pick it up and can't find it. A fluorescent color for training might be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: G9195

customer_reviews.title: Very excellent quality, great for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely balanced and crafted, stick very easily, And good for beginners, very sharp when I got them, and they are very durable. Strong and feel nice in my hands
customer_reviews.author: Orien

customer_reviews.title: One of the reviews mentioned that points were dull. That was not correct in my case
customer_reviews.text: First of all, i was NOT compensated, in any way for writing this review. I'm brand new to the world of throwing knives. Bought those based on reviews. They are perfectly balanced, quite heavy and sharp. One of the reviews mentioned that points were dull. That was not correct in my case. They are large enough for man's hands. Learning how to throw them is up to you - there are plenty of videos on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Estraven

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Tough!!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, when i bought these I wasnt expecting much for such a low cost. But I was totally wrong! These knives are extremely tough, I have been trying new styles of throwing and have alot of misses that bounce on concrete. Not one break not one blade chip after hundreds of throws. They are sharper compared to other throwing so be cautious when throwing. But for the price you absolutely cannot go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good I guess. I’m just starting and they seem to do the job. Still searching for the right set
customer_reviews.author: BLC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well-balanced knives
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy, well-balanced knives. For 8" knives, they're terrific, but if I had it to do over again, I would have gone with heavier, 10"+ throwing knives instead. Still, for $10, you can experiment with knife-throwing without breaking the bank, and you can always upgrade later.
customer_reviews.author: opinionatED

customer_reviews.title: Good quality great price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Just put up a piece of plywood in the backyard to practice. Made for some Fun games.
customer_reviews.author: jzuni

customer_reviews.title: These blades are amazing. I used to throw a bit when I ...
customer_reviews.text: These blades are amazing. I used to throw a bit when I was younger but never had a set of knives. These are a bit different, but the blades are perfectly balanced and sharp! It is taking me a bit to get the exact technique for these blades, but that is entirely me, not the blades. When they hit, they stick. They even survived one extremely clumsy throw that bounced one off a rock (I cringed, the blade was still perfect). I am thinking about getting a second set.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Cypher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Ballance
customer_reviews.text: These are quality throwing knives. They are balanced and feel nice in the hand. I throw from the handle, the tip and underhand 1/4 rotation with no problem. 9" is about as small as I like, preferring 12". If you are a new to knife throwing I would suggest starting with a 12" knife,but, if you require a shorter knife this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: ScottJ

customer_reviews.title: Okay. But not great, not even good, just okay.
customer_reviews.text: These do not have very sharp points and kind of on the heavier side I’d say. They do not stick well in wood targets ive made for previous blades and axe throwing.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality, Easy to throw, Good Value.
customer_reviews.text: These arrived quickly and were packaged good. They stuck with every throw and seem solid and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: CrankyOldFart

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: They ok for card board, no edge at all and way to light
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good knives.  Good deal.
customer_reviews.text: The knives came in very good shape. They were sharp and had no abrasions on the black finish. I wasn't a huge fan of the spider clip art logo because I felt it was a little cartoonish, but the blades themselves are good. Are there better throwing knives? Most certainly, but for the cost of these three you'll be hard-pressed to find a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: good throwing
customer_reviews.text: I thought that these knives were a little light, but after throwing for about 2 hours, I really like them. I throw on the back porch and there is a cement slab they bounce off once in a while, they can take a beating and remain sharp. Nice knives
customer_reviews.author: ralphy

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Fun
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my daughter, who loved The Hunger Games and wanted to try throwing knives (yes, I'm one of those crazy parents). We set up a scrap piece of formica as a target (back side with the pressboard) and it worked great. I do NOT recommend using hay bales as a target- we had to dig the knives out. This was a great purchase, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: HappyMom

customer_reviews.title: Professional product for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I loved them. The material is of good quality. They don’t bend lose shape or sharpness no matter what you throw them against or smash them into. The colors haven’t faded at all so far!
customer_reviews.author: Nessel

customer_reviews.title: Meh quality, but good for beginners -if you're in China.
customer_reviews.text: China made, which wasn't mentioned in desc. Not buying PP products anymore.
customer_reviews.author: jbej1

customer_reviews.title: These have been a great set for my son to use for beginning throwing
customer_reviews.text: These have been a great set for my son to use for beginning throwing. They are weighted well, sturdy, and sharper than I expected them to be. He's thrown them a lot and hasn't lost a tip yet! He uses a wood board he bought at the lumber yard for throwing into.
customer_reviews.author: HappyChickenLady

customer_reviews.title: Great overall cheap knife!
customer_reviews.text: These baby's are good, they have a very good balance from the middle. I have to mention though the blade isn't sharp which is good for blade throwers. I had mine for about 4 months, no chips on the tip which is great. The stick like if they're brand new. They're really strong. Over all there a good set of knives for a beginner like me, you can throw them at cement and wont chip. I recommend these knives. Perfect practice make perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Flores

customer_reviews.title: Throw with Abandon – Well, Sort of...
customer_reviews.text: These really inexpensive throwing knives are outstanding for teaching my students how easy it is for anyone to learn how to be lethal with even common steak knives; therefore, these were purchased as classroom demonstration tools in support of students learning agent safety while pursuing wanted felony fugitives. All in all, I would suggest that knife throwing students wear protective eyewear and thick clothing in the event of a bounce back. These are a good choice for learning, no doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Venator

customer_reviews.title: Good Value / Quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and easy to use... light enough for kids to throw. The tips can get dulled fast, but a file can resharpen them.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a beginner because they were like 10 bucks. I mean u get what you pay for. The set scratches super easily and comes super sharp. Cut myself real quick as blade became crooked. Also really hard to sharpen and returns are apparently not offered. Stay away. Invest in some high quality knives.
customer_reviews.author: Abdullah Ansari

customer_reviews.title: Excellent handle-heavy throwing knives!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were right. These are excellent throwing knives. I like the single-edge, handle-heavy configuration. It throws very easily and accurately at 10 feet. The handle design allows you to increase the holding distance from the point in order to add force to the throw. I haven't tested it yet, but I'd say these should be good and accurate at 20 feet. I'm gonna order 2 more units.
customer_reviews.author: Tben

customer_reviews.title: He says they are perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my fiance' for a Valentine's day gift (yes I know strange but trust me I know my man and this is something he has wanted for long time) I got them in the mail only a couple of days after I ordered them and I gave them to him a couple of days early and he absolutely loves them. He says they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Not a great throwing knife. But it's ok just to throw arou.d and not care if it gets damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Balance
customer_reviews.text: These are the most balanced throwing knives I have ever handled. I have had them for a couple years now. I misplaced them unfortunately, so I will drfinitely be getting another set of these!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Sizer

customer_reviews.title: great cheap knives
customer_reviews.text: these are great for messing around and learning on. I've never thrown knives before, but wanted to give it a try. These were shipped fast and balanced fairly well for what I can tell. Like I said, I'm not a pro, so someone who throws knives everyday, might think otherwise. I've thrown them for a couple of months now. they are still holding up, haven't broken, and I still get pleasure from throwing them. I'm still not a pro...
customer_reviews.author: aqua123

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Fair price.
customer_reviews.text: I’m always a little worried about Amazon purchases, but these little throwing knives i’ve proven to be a great purchase for this beginner. I’d like to find exactly the same thing, a little bigger, a little thicker bit I’m well pleased. Great product for the price. The Velcro on the sheath would work much better with a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Gregg

customer_reviews.title: FUN
customer_reviews.text: I bought the plain ones and they've held up well. I'm a beginner so these knives have seen some sh*t hahaha and they aren't broken yet. The balance is good, and aside from dirt and scratches, they only dent if they fly into rocks. They're also great for stress relief. I take them out in the woods and chuck them at trees
customer_reviews.author: Shane M

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Fun
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted throwing knives since I was a kid. This is my first set of throwing knives and they are extremely fun. I've been throwing them at boxes and logs and have gotten to be good enough to go 3 for 3 at about 15 feet. If you have ever wanted to learn to throw knives I would say this is a great set to start with. I rated 4 stars because the tips bend super easily (I had no choice but to be throwing them over gravel for a while) but you can always hammer them or dremel them back into shape. Overall I am very satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: This made a great gift and is supposed to be used to exercise arms.
customer_reviews.author: J Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic knives
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Sharp edge and tip. Good balance. Fantastic price.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: awesome!
customer_reviews.text: this is great for beginners or skilled knife throwers. the looks are outstanding and will make it something you would love.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp enough to be useful, even for fun
customer_reviews.text: The blades are not sharp to cut nor sharp to stick into wood when thrown. They are rather lightweight which might also be why they do not throw well.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good item for the money it’s worth! It looks nice and is satisfying to throw! I recommend ply wood for the best sticks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun throwing knives. Small and sharp blades
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my girlfriend and she’s really good with them. The only drawbacks are they’re a little small and the blades are sharp, but she sticks them with ease and looks like a total bad-ass while doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Kuchie-san

customer_reviews.title: Good but will want a bigger version mountain man Bowie ...
customer_reviews.text: Good but will want a bigger version mountain man Bowie type. Or anything 12 to 15 inches. Can throw by blade or handle. Tip: keep ALL four fingers wrapped around the handle below. Instead of having your pointer finger on top and the other three wrapped below.
customer_reviews.author: yand hyu wat

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice, simple throwing knives. Did not help my knife throwing skill at all, but I'll keep trying.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful knifes. Came oiled and ready to throw. The knifes even came in a week early. I'm a soldier in germany so everything takes about 2 to 3 weeks to arrive but they got here with a week. The knifes alone are sturdy sharp and wonderful learning tools
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good weight good balance easy to throw
customer_reviews.text: These throw easy and stick deep. Great balance and so far they haven't broken. They are a good weight.
customer_reviews.author: its me

customer_reviews.title: For the price, great knives.
customer_reviews.text: Attached you will see the poor focus of decal & profile/grind knife details; which happens to be inconsistent between knives even though I only show one example. This should not deter your purchase, for the knives themselves are solid, and excellent training tools for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon P.

customer_reviews.title: Knives from Divergent!
customer_reviews.text: Good throwing knives, even though I really never got the hang of it. I also thought it was interesting to see that these were the exact knives used in the movie Divergent... except the white spider had been painted black. I recognized them pretty easy when I saw the movie later on.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: but I looked like a badass the whole time and my eyes didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Took 3 hours to cut up an onion in the kitchen from the living room, but I looked like a badass the whole time and my eyes didn't tear up once. I would subtract half a star because the wife was not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Magilla

customer_reviews.title: would recommend to a friend
customer_reviews.text: kills my foes with ease. would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Throwing Knife
customer_reviews.text: This is my first set of throwing knives and I decided to purchase them after reading good reviews. I did some reading online and decided to use them. They work very well. They seemed to be well balanced and can be thrown with ease using the correct technique. I would recommend them to those who are beginners or advanced.
customer_reviews.author: Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Buy these if you're a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great sharp knives for a great price. If you're just starting out throwing knives, like I am, then you should buy these. Good weight and feels good in the hand. If I ruin these or lose interest then no biggie since they're pretty cheap.
customer_reviews.author: christt

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Novice thrower here. I like these knives. Already lost one in my woods. My fault for not using ribbon. Really like these knives though. I like that it has a cut out for attaching ribbon, given that it is black and can disappear easily in the leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Good?
customer_reviews.text: Got as a gift for a friend. They seem cool but after 4 years I haven’t heard him talk about them once so they can’t be that special
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Drew

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to a solid target
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be pretty decent blades. I use a pecan hickory in my yard for a target and they are holding up pretty good. One of the knife tips is slightly dulled after a few dozen throws, but nothing a sharpening stone can't fix. Overall, I like these a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Golden

customer_reviews.title: It was not what I expect
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad, but It'a not what I expect from a throwing knife.
customer_reviews.author: Moha

customer_reviews.title: My 1st throwing set.
customer_reviews.text: Love what I got for the price. Good set for inexperienced individuals trying something new. Product feels balanced and design have good feel. It also comes with 1 soft sleeve for all 3.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Fun and good price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted these for Christmas. Not being that in to throwing knives, this set is a perfect price point to just try this out. The worked really well, and by the end of Christmas day she was throwing them through cardboard and sticking into plywood from 8-12 feet away. The worked great.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners but...
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners and practice. But the blade is a little handle heavy, and after just an hour of target practice with a wood board one of the knives tip broke off. If the tip hadn’t have broken I definitely would give this product five stars, the danger of the tip breaking off made me give this product three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Having a little fun, life is short.
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift, and she was tickled pink.
customer_reviews.author: Jonh Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Give em a throw
customer_reviews.text: Decent throwing knives. They are not high dollar but definitely worth the money. A lot of fun
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Nice Knive Set!!
customer_reviews.text: My son bought these for practice. He liked how they looked, how sturdy they were and the sharpness of the point for hitting the target. They are well balanced and he liked the pouch for his belt loop to carry them. They are very durable and though much use, are still looking great. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff-n-Beth

customer_reviews.title: Well made product.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best but good for the price i bought 3 sets. great for teaching throwing.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Sanderson

customer_reviews.title: good throwing knifes
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to use them in grass arias to make the last Sharpen them They are good quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband for Christmas and he absolutely loves them!! Great durability!
customer_reviews.author: heather atterbury

customer_reviews.title: Cheap BUT Quality
customer_reviews.text: What better way to feel like a badass samurai than throwing knives or stars around the yard? These things are great. Still sharp and pointy...
customer_reviews.author: ESR

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and buy a good quality product with 200 gram or heavier blades
customer_reviews.text: I would not give zero stars on most products. However, once I learned this is NOT ELIGIBLE for a return, I'm changing from 2 stars to 1 stars. These are not worth the $10 price tag. They're so light and flimsy that one would never learn how to throw a knife well with them. I wish I could return them, but since the company won't accept them, I'll throw them in the trash. Do yourself a favor and buy a good quality product with 200 gram or heavier blades. Don't bother with this ineffective, cheap product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L. Biska

product_meta.title: Perfect Point RC-1793B Throwing Knife Set with Three Knives, Black Blades, Steel Handles, 8-Inch Overall
feature_bullets: 3-piece throwing knife set provides a well balanced throw every time
Black stainless steel construction; spider printed decoration
Laser cut-out at end of handle allows a ribbon to be tied on
Includes black nylon sheath for easy and safe transport
